title: Software Engineer II, Collaboration Systems
description: Company Description Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. We build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect millions of entrepreneurs with millions of buyers around the world. As an Etsy Inc. employee, whether a team member of Etsy, Reverb, or Depop, you will tackle unique, meaningful, and large-scale problems alongside passionate coworkers, all the while making a rewarding impact and Keeping Commerce Human. Salary Range $131,000.00 - $170,000.00 What‚Äôs the role? We are looking for a Software Engineer to join the Collaboration Systems and Enterprise Tooling team within our Internal IT department. The team is dedicated to delivering the enterprise tools, solutions, and services that enable productivity, collaboration, and a great user experience for all Etsy employees. The ideal candidate will be capable of working alongside a multidisciplinary engineering team, and will bring experience and skills in workflow automation, integration engineering, enterprise SaaSOps, and developing quality software solutions to augment enterprise SaaS tools. We‚Äôre looking for people who are great communicators, share a passion for tackling complexity, enjoy coaching and mentoring others, and take a user centric approach in crafting solutions. This is a full-time position reporting to the Engineering Manager of Collaboration Systems and Enterprise Tooling. In addition to salary, you will also be eligible for an equity package, an annual performance bonus, and our competitive benefits that support you and your family as part of your total rewards package at Etsy. For this role, we are considering candidates based in the United States. Candidates living within commutable distance of Etsy‚Äôs Brooklyn Office Hub or in the San Francisco Bay Area may be the first to be considered. For candidates within commutable distance, Etsy requires in-office attendance once or twice per week depending on your proximity to the office. Etsy offers different work modes to meet the variety of needs and preferences of our team. Learn more details about our work modes and workplace safety policies here. What‚Äôs this team like at Etsy? CSEnT engineers evaluate, design, and deliver products, tools and services that enhance the efficiency and connectivity of every Etsy employee. The team has a broad set of skills encompassing internal infrastructure, operations, engineering, analytics, and product management for enterprise tools that gives them the flexibility to deliver both 3rd party ‚Äúoff the shelf‚Äù products as well as build their own solutions and integrations. The team provides end-to-end ownership and continuous optimization of critical enterprise SaaS systems used by all Etsy employees in their day to day work. They also enable teams across Etsy through tool and user lifecycle management, and development of solutions improving productivity, workflow efficiencies, and business insights. We work closely with our internal customers and partner teams to understand their needs, address friction points and provide solutions and services to meet those needs. We prioritize speed to learning over perfection and build space in our timelines to clean up and iterate. We prioritize equitable treatment, inclusivity, and diversity. What does the day-to-day look like? Contribute at all levels of Etsy‚Äôs enterprise technology stack, ranging from configuration management, to cloud infrastructure and tooling, enterprise collaboration and productivity tooling, and related services. Work independently or in collaboration with the CSEnT team to design, develop, and maintain solutions to integrate or enhance SaaS tooling, and automate manual processes and workflows Collaborate with our partner teams and business leaders across Etsy to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements that improve the value of our SaaS portfolio. Help grow and mentor teammates and more junior engineers in technical and non-technical areas of work, including detailed and constructive design and code reviews. Gain and share insights through research, user interviews, data analysis, and A/B tests. Push code to production early and often using our continuous deployment systems. Develop quality solutions, using performance monitoring tooling, automated and manual testing, and observability tools to verify the correctness and quality of your code. Practice and promote continuous learning, engineering best practices, and agile delivery models to stay informed and focused on our enterprise tools and services. Participate in an on-call rotation and incident response. Of course, this is just a sample of the kinds of work this role will require! You should assume that your role will encompass other tasks, too, and that your job duties and responsibilities may change from time to time at Etsy's discretion, or otherwise applicable with local law. Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are: 3+ years of experience deploying, managing, and supporting enterprise SaaS systems and their native and custom integrations. Experience applying REST APIs to integrate standalone SaaS applications and gather SaaS tools insights. The ability to write understandable, testable code with an eye towards maintainability, usability, and scalability. Partnering as a strong collaborator and communicator to support the team around you grow and learn. You take a user-centric approach, considering the implications of your work on the end user experience and factoring user needs and ways of working into your solutions. Strong problem-solving skills including the ability to diagnose and solve technical problems in familiar systems, complete root cause analysis, and deploy permanent corrective actions. Demonstrated experience in one or more of the following languages: PHP, Python, Go, JavaScript Are invested in Etsy‚Äôs vision, mission and values. Additional Information What's Next If you're interested in joining the team at Etsy, please share your resume with us and feel free to include a cover letter if you'd like. As we hope you've seen already, Etsy is a place that values individuality and variety. We don't want you to be like everyone else -- we want you to be like you! So tell us what you're all about. Our Promise At Etsy, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace furthers relevance, resilience, and longevity. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Etsy is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If, due to a disability, you need an accommodation during any part of the interview process, please let your recruiter know. While Etsy supports visa sponsorship, sponsorship opportunities may be limited to certain roles and skills.

title: Developer (Web Application)

Preferred Skills Candidates must have strong supervisory and development skills and the ability to transform complex requirements into applications that are user-friendly and easy to navigate, as-well-as, as display an ability to communicate and work in a team setting. Candidates with at least three years of experience working with .NET Technologies (C#, .NET Framework, .NET Core/5, MVC, WebForms, WebAPI, WCF Services, Windows Services, LINQ, Asynchronous /S Multithreaded Programming, Visual Studio.NET 2017/2019, Team Foundation Services and/or Azure Dev Ops) is preferred. Experience with AJAX, HTML 5, CSS and JavaScript along with frameworks such as jQuery, Bootstrap, AngularJS, ReactJS, and/or Angular 7/10+ Microsoft SQL Server, creating data definitions, SSIS packages, and complex database objects MCSD or MCP or MCSE or MCITP: Web Applications are preferred. title: Backend engineer
description: About Us We're on a mission to transform spoken communication for individuals, teams and organizations of any size. Meetings may be our most information-rich channel for work, but suffer from a lack of structure and documentation. At Supernormal, we're solving this problem with focus, design and craft. We've been working on this since 2019 and have customers like Snap, Salesforce, Replay, Gitcoin, Pinterest and thousands more on this journey with us. Today, we are growing rapidly and are excited for new teammates to join who are the best at what they do. We're passionately building a team that is as diverse and creative as the millions of people we serve worldwide. Supernormal is a remote first company and does not require co-location. We have annual team retreats and gather several times a quarter. About The Role Back-end engineers at Supernormal own projects large and small from start to finish. As a backend engineer, you'll focus on building on and evolving our API consumed by clients including our web app and Chrome extension. You'll help instrument our stack and make things fast. Most of all, you'll build reliable and secure services using the most advanced AI models to generate millions of high-quality meeting notes every month for a rapidly growing customer base. You'll work closely with engineers, our machine learning team, and product designers to deliver incredible customer experiences. What You'll Work On You'll expand and maintain our Rails API You'll build new features primarily with Ruby & Python You'll continuously improve our codebase You'll watch over and take care of our Postgres database and Redis instances You'll stand up machines, internal dashboards, and other tooling to support our core services In this role, you'll be expanding and maintaining our Rails API where you'll deploy your expertise in Ruby to establish robust business logic that supports processing millions of hours of meeting data.. You'll primarily use Ruby to build new features, but you won't be limited to just one technology. Collaboration will be key, as you engage with our AI researchers and engineers to bring state-of-the-art techniques, classifiers, and models from research to product. A key aspect of your role involves advocating for and implementing new, improved processes, ensuring that everything you touch leaves a lasting positive impact. Our tech stack includes Ruby on Rails for backend development, Python for scripting, and JavaScript/TypeScript for frontend development with React. We manage our databases using Postgres and utilize Redis for caching. Requirements What you will bring The ideal candidate is a versatile Back End Engineer who excels in crafting reliable, efficient code. You will thrive in cross-functional collaboration, leveraging your innovative mindset to seamlessly integrate AI-driven solutions into our product ecosystem. Your expertise will ensure our backend infrastructure is robust, scalable, and capable of supporting advanced features and high-performance requirements. Proven experience: 5+ years of solid experience in a comparable role and context, showcasing your expertise Recent production experience: contribute 2-3 years of recent experience from a position involving the release of production code in Ruby Collaborative work history: showcase demonstrated experience working harmoniously with fellow engineers and designers to achieve common goals Proactive improvement: cultivate a habit of proactively enhancing systems without explicit prompting Problem-solving proficiency: showcase your knack for problem-solving by demonstrating experience in dissecting logs, error messages, and event data Helpful attitude: exhibit a genuine desire and willingness to assist, even when tasks fall outside your defined scope of responsibility Open-minded approach: if you meet most, but not all requirements, don't hesitate to reach out‚Äîwe're eager to hear from you What We'll Expect Of You A collaborative and open outlook ‚Äî we're all about lifting each other up and getting better every day A willingness to get deep into a problem even when it seems impossible Confidence operating with high agency. We'll work together to decide what's important, but we'd love for you to bring (and build!) your own ideas You'll come in willing to learn why things are the way they are, then suggest a better way What You Can Expect From Us We're a fully distributed team spread between Pacific Time (Seattle) and Central European Time (Stockholm) with lots of places in between. We'll see you most days in Slack, Google Meet, GitHub issues, and Notion. Sometimes in person in a place with a warm breeze We're a friendly bunch and are happy to pair, talk through, or otherwise assist any time Honest and timely feedback. We're all better when we can have candid conversations about what is and isn't working A willingness to listen to your ideas: how can the codebase, our product, or team be better? A respect for your time outside of work. We all work hard here, but we never forget to rest and have fun Benefits üí∞ Competitive salary, 401K üìà Stock options üè• Full healthcare coverage (Medical, Dental, and Vision) üöÄ Totally remote. Not hybrid. Remote. No return-to-office here üè† WFH budget to make sure you have everything you need to do your best work ‚úàÔ∏è Annual team-wide offsite to someplace cool üéì Education credit (up to $500 per year) üß≥ Unlimited PTO (minimum 4 weeks)

We‚Äôre building an AI-native business intelligence platform with a clear focus on redefining what's possible in bookkeeping, financial management, inventory, supply-chain, and operational efficiency. Teams struggle with fragmented, inefficient, and manual systems that make it difficult to effectively manage critical financial, strategic, and operational processes. Strategic Vision: As a crucial member of our founding team, your technical insight will guide Focus AI towards realizing its full potential. You foresee technological trends, identify technical opportunities, and tackle engineering challenges. Entrepreneurial Spirit: Joining Focus AI is about making a significant impact and building a lasting legacy in the business intelligence space. Our Essence Driven by Mission: We‚Äôre going to create a generation-defining platform that changes the way midcap businesses operate. ** Unprecedented Collaboration**: Our team is our greatest asset. We're building a culture where everyone is empowered to take initiative and build. Embrace the Journey: Recognizing the unique opportunity we have to impact an industry, we approach our work with positivity, enthusiasm, and a readiness to overcome challenges. Promise To You A Seat at the Table: You're joining us at inception with the chance to shape the direction of the company. Your voice matters here. World-Class Support: Backed by top-tier investors and an experienced founding team, you'll have the resources and guidance to make bold moves. Comprehensive Rewards: Competitive compensation, significant equity stake, exceptional benefits, and a commitment to your personal and professional growth. Impactful Work: Here, your work directly contributes to building a generational company. We're creating something that will redefine an industry and positively affect millions of lives. We're looking for a unique individual ready to join us in creating the future. If you're driven by impact, innovation, and the desire to lead a generational-defining company, let's build this future together.

title: Full Stack Engineer, Developer Products
description: Who we are About Stripe Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career. About The Team Developer Products builds tools that empower our developer users to build and integrate with Stripe. We aim to create new tools and experiences that can solve hard problems for our developer users that still give them meaningful and high-leverage ways for them to integrate. Our surface area ranges from hosted surfaces like Stripe Workbench to installable tools like the Stripe CLI and Stripe for VS Code, to backend services like a websocket multiplexor for event streaming. What you‚Äôll do Responsibilities Build new products and tools (like Workbench and the Stripe CLI) that improve Stripe's developer experience Add new features to existing products, continuing to keep our developer experience first-in-class Influence the direction of our developer products by gathering insights and feedback from our developer community Work across different products, tech stacks, and programming languages Turn ambiguous problems that our developer users are facing into concrete products, from proposal, to kick-off, to building, and launch Who you are We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement. Minimum Requirements 5+ years in engineering across a wide range of products Prior experience building tools and products for developers Comfortable jumping between both backend and frontend systems Comfortable working directly with users Strong product mindset Preferred Qualifications Experience with multiple languages (Ruby, Go, Java, Node‚Ä¶) Prior experience working across many teams Hybrid work at Stripe This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office). Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live. Pay and benefits The annual US base salary range for this role is $136,800 - $205,200. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process. Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.

Role Description This is a full-time role for a Full Stack Web Developer at Parambil. Your primary focus will be full stack web development. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining our AI-powered knowledge platform. You will collaborate with a world class team to ensure the platform's performance, reliability, and scalability. The team works in person in NYC - remote options are available. Qualifications 3-6 YoE (post-BS/MS) in a web development role Bachelors degree (4 years) in Computer Science Full-stack, product-oriented engineer Expertise with React, Typescript, Javascript Have worked with AWS You may be a strong fit for this role if you: Are excited to work at the intersection of healthcare and law Have built web applications end to end Have previous experience working at an early-stage startup

title: Mid Level Software Engineer (New York City)
description: As a engineer at Bask you will work directly with the CEO and CTO to build and design the software infrastructure that will serve as the backbone of telehealth. We are looking to expand our software engineers, seeking those with deep rooted entrepreneurial spirit. Our serverless platform is built using Next.js, Drizzle and PlanetScale for a powerful multi-tenant application. It is important to be fluent in these frameworks, with Javascript and API architecture being a must. What You'll Do Design, build, and implement new services through the full development cycle: write elegant, well-tested code in a modern technology stack. Build libraries and frameworks that can help us build quickly and efficiently, and deliver value to our users. Work closely with the product team: make architecture and design decisions, participate in stand-ups, code reviews, and retros, and help contribute and drive the engineering culture that focuses on simple, intuitive, high-impact experiences. Be an engineering generalist: from developing servers and databases, to integrating APIs to expand our platforms capabilities, to final Ul implementation, to you'll have the opportunity to take end-to-end ownership and responsibility across the full development lifecycle. Build from 0 to 1: You'll have the opportunity to both scale and automate existing services while also bringing new innovations to life. This is unique opportunity to help join a team where you'll be able to both build rapidly, and also contribute to product strategy and development! We are a highly collaborative team. Who We're Looking For The ideal candidate is a full-stack generalist, and has experience taking a product from 0-1 product. We're looking for someone who's entrepreneurial and willing to roll up their sleeves to get the work done, and passionate about our mission to build a platform that will intensely disrupt the healthcare industry. You are dangerous on the frontend of the stack. You are a highly skilled dev (React, TypeScript, Next.js, JavaScript, Tailwind). You have backend skills (SST, Lambda, Rust, mySQL, DynamoDB, Node). You can work independently and are comfortable owning entire projects and or large areas of the code base Strong experience in building paid products and services is preferred. You are a strong communicator - you are able to clearly articulate technical problems, constraints and timelines. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced, unstructured, startup environment.

title: Java Developer
description: Role: Java Developer Location: Albany, New York Duration: 30 Months Description This position will be in support of the NYS Tax Modernization Program. This program will encompass multiple projects to modernize legacy systems within the NYS Department of Taxation and Finance, which is responsible for billions in state revenue. Assist team members using distributed technologies including Java, DB2, XML and XQuery. Ensure that staff members are properly trained and mentored.
